Author: George Orwell
Description: A dystopian social science fiction novel and cautionary tale.

Name: To Kill a Mockingbird
Author: Harper Lee
Description: A novel about the serious issues of rape and racial inequality.

Name: The Great Gatsby
Author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
Description: A novel about the American dream and the roaring twenties.

Name: One Hundred Years of Solitude
Author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez
Description: A multi-generational story of the Buendia family.

Name: Moby-Dick
Author: Herman Melville
Description: A novel about the voyage of the whaling ship Pequod.

Name: Pride and Prejudice
Author: Jane Austen
Description: A romantic novel that critiques the British landed gentry at the end of the 18th century.

Name: War and Peace
Author: Leo Tolstoy
Description: A novel that chronicles the history of the French invasion of Russia.

Name: The Catcher in the Rye
Author: J.D. Salinger
Description: A story about the events and conversations of a teenage boy.

Name: The Hobbit
Author: J.R.R. Tolkien
Description: A children's fantasy novel about the adventures of Bilbo Baggins.

Name: Crime and Punishment
Author: Fyodor Dostoevsky
Description: A novel about the mental anguish and moral dilemmas of an impoverished ex-student.

Name: The Odyssey
Author: Homer
Description: An epic poem about the journey of Odysseus.

Name: Brave New World
Author: Aldous Huxley
Description: A dystopian novel about a future World State.

Name: Jane Eyre
Author: Charlotte Brontë
Description: A novel that follows the emotions and experiences of its heroine.

Name: Wuthering Heights
Author: Emily Brontë
Description: A novel about the intense, and almost demonic love between Catherine Earnshaw and Heathcliff.

Name: The Divine Comedy
Author: Dante Alighieri
Description: An epic poem about the journey through Hell, Purgatory, and Paradise.
